title: Combining TST Targets with the MSD
text: vignette provides overview utilizing tame_dp() output combining previous targets MER Structured Dataset (MSD).

title: Combining TST Targets with the MSD
text: haven’t installed R tameDP, first refer Setup vignette want know options tame_dp(), see Extracting Targets. addition loading tameDP, ’re also going need install/load couple others. ’ll working packages installed dependencies tameDP, need use two packages: another custom OHA package called gophr. Let’s install bothS now. Alright, gophr installed work MSD, let’s get going. first step reading Target Setting Tool (TST) file. going work targets target tabs, assuming PSNUxIM yet populated. Remember, Windows filepaths slash wrong direction. need replace backslashes (“/") filepath forward slashes (”/“). now targets extracted TST stored tidy dataframe called df_tst. want combine MSD. need download country’s full MSD PEPFAR Panorama Genie Extract DATIM. analysis, let’s look across PSNUs want download PSNUxIM dataset. downloaded, want use gophr::read_psd() open MSD. PSNUxIM file columns need TST output processed time column won’t need. also indicators disaggregates aren’t Data Pack. simplify matters, can subset, limit, dataset work . Luckily table stored packaged called mer_disagg_mapping contains indicators disaggregates can use filter MSD . Combining names Data Pack data frame (names(df_tst)) limit columns using inner join keep target disaggregates, can append bind onto MSD data frame. TST also historic fiscal year data addition planning year duplicated MSD ’ll need remove well. now joined data frame can use compare indicator trends time. instance, can compare year’s TX_NEW targets compare previous years’ targets across ages. Finally, can reshape data get easy table view trends.
code: install.packages("here") install.packages('gophr', repos = c('https://usaid-oha-si.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org')) library(tameDP) library(gophr) library(dplyr) library(tidyr) library(here) #data pack file path tst_filepath <- here("tools/DataPack_Jupiter_20600101.xlsx") #process the data pack to extract the targets df_tst <- tame_dp(tst_filepath)  #glimpse the output glimpse(df_tst) #msd file path msd_filepath <- here("../../../Downloads/MER_Structured_Datasets_PSNU_IM_FY45-49_Jupiter.txt")  #read in MSD df_msd <- read_psd(msd_filepath) #extra column names in the MSD that don't exist in the TST setdiff(names(df_msd), names(df_tst))  #exta columns in the TST that don't exist in the MSD setdiff(names(df_tst), names(df_msd)) mer_disagg_mapping #remove extra column from the tidy TST df_tst <- select(df_tst, -source_processed)  #remove extra columns from MSD df_msd_lim <- select(df_msd, all_of(names(df_tst)))   #subset MSD data to only indicators/disaggs that exist in the TST (inner_join is acting like filter) df_msd_lim <- df_msd_lim %>%    inner_join(mer_disagg_mapping, by = c("indicator", "standardizeddisaggregate", "numeratordenom"))  #remove duplicative data df_tst <- df_tst %>%    filter(fiscal_year > max(df_tst$fiscal_year))  #bind TST data frame onto MSD df_msd_tst <- df_msd_lim %>%    bind_rows(df_tst) %>%    glimpse() df_tx_trend <- df_msd_tst %>%    filter(indicator == "TX_NEW",          standardizeddisaggregate == "Age/Sex/HIVStatus") %>%    count(fiscal_year, indicator, ageasentered, wt = targets, name = "targets") df_tx_trend %>%   filter(fiscal_year >= 2048) %>%    pivot_wider(names_from = fiscal_year,               values_from = targets)

title: Extracting Targets
text: vignette provides overview extracting targets data using tameDP. ’ll learn different parameters extract different components COP Target Setting Tool.

title: Extracting Targets
text: haven’t installed R tameDP, first refer Setup vignette. everything installed, want launch R RStudio (IDE R). use tameDP need load working environment. Enter line console initiate package.

title: Extracting Targets
text: first thing want load tameDP tell R Target Setting Tool (TST) located computer. Windows Explorer (outside R), navigate Target Setting Tool file, hold SHIFT key right click file name. gives additional option “Copy path”, want click. Now path saved clipboard. Open R paste copied filepath Console script. hit enter, need store path object R using assignment operator <-. let’s us store information use later point pass different functions. call object, tst_filepath. important note Windows filepaths slash wrong direction. need replace backslashes (“/") filepath forward slashes (”/“). command store file path object look like code , replaced file path path file.

title: Extracting Targets
text: different forms data can get Target Setting Tool. first extracting targets relevant tabs. data PSNU level, broken relevant disagregates (e.g. Age/Sex/HIVStatus). function , used filepath stored pass function. function take seconds minutes run depending size Target Setting Tool. data extracted Target Setting Tool stored objected called df_tst. browse data frame (df) using function like View(df_tst) dplyr::glimpse(df_tst), ’ll see structure similar MER Structured Dataset (MSD). following columns: operatingunit, countryname, snu1, psnu, psnuuid, fiscal_year, indicator, standardizeddisaggregate, numeratordenom, ageasentered, sex, modality, statushiv, otherdisaggregate, targets. output bit manageable work using Target Setting Tool.

title: Extracting Targets
text: comfortable working R, can use df_tst object munge, analyze, visualize data. prefer get data work Excel, Tableau, another program, can export data data frame ’s stored csv file using readr package. need tell R object want export; can use df_tst got running tame_dp(tst_filepath) Extracting Targets section. want change file path name chunk .

title: Extracting Targets
text: function , provided filepath function returned data frame targets Target Setting Tool. Function R often multiple parameters. Take minute look help file tame_dp(). can see different parameter allow us return different things. default, function returning specific type FALSE two parameters. look help file, see three options type - “PSNUxIM”, “PLHIV”, “” (default) specific tab. option using “” giving us targets tabs. see change option “PLHIV”. , return PLHIV NAT_SUBNAT data Cascade tab Target Setting Tool. function structure , adding type parameter order return PLHIV NAT_SUBNAT data instead targets. structure data frame ran targets, difference indicators returned (indicator). Last least option return type = "PSNUxIM", pull data PSNUxIM tab Target Setting Tool (OPU). tab name type indicate, data PSNU mechanism level. last type option returns mech_code Target Setting Tool targets assigned . Target Setting Tool doesn’t include mechanism name prime partner columns left blank. include info, can set map_names = TRUE function. run function, pop-window asking type DATIM user name password pull information DATIM. Previously, public information, DHIS2 update, data became password protected. final parameter function psnu_lvl gives user option aggregate data PSNU level (working PSNUxIM). Since tame_dp can pull target tabs PSNU level, isn’t useful now, can useful working PSNUxIM tab, OPU.
code: ?tame_dp tame_dp(tst_filepath, type = "ALL", map_names = FALSE, psnu_lvl = FALSE) #return IMPATT/SUBNAT data df_subnat <- tame_subnat(tst_filepath)  #return data from a specific tab - TB df_tb <- tamep_dp(tst_filepath, type = "TB") df_tst_mech <- tame_dp(tst_filepath, type = "PSNUxIM") df_tst_mech_info <- tame_dp(tst_filepath, type = "PSNUxIM", map_names = TRUE) df_tst_psnu <- tame_dp(tst_filepath, type = "PSNUxIM", psnu_lvl = TRUE)

title: Extracting Targets
text: can use one map() functions purrr package read multiple Target Setting Tools combine rather working one . may relevant ’re reviewing regional operating unit Washington. get pop time provide DATIM credentials don’t stored session. recommend using getPass::getPass() storing credentials don’t type script console (visual history).
code: #load package   library(purrr)   library(getPass)  #identify all the Target Setting Tool files   files <- list.files("../Downloads/TSTs", full.names = TRUE)  #read in all DPs and combine into one data frame   df_combo <- map_dfr(.x = files,                       .f = ~ tame_dp(.x))                      #store DATIM credentials   dtm_usr <- "spower" #replace with your credentials   dtm_pwd <- getPass() #pop up prompting for your password    #apply mech_name and primepartner names from DATIM   df_combo <- get_names(df_combo, datim_user = dtm_usr, datim_password = dtm_pwd)

what:
Import targets and PLHIV data from COP Target Setting Tool (formerly Data 
   Pack)
title:
Import targets and PLHIV data from COP Target Setting Tool (formerly Data 
   Pack)
text: Imports tidies data PEPFAR, Excel-based Target Setting Tool (formerly known Data Pack) Historic versions available back COP19.

title:
Import targets and PLHIV data from COP Target Setting Tool (formerly Data 
   Pack)
text: tameDP CRAN, install directly rOpenSci GitHub using code found .
code: ## SETUP    #install from rOpenSci     install.packages('tameDP', repos = c('https://usaid-oha-si.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))        #alt: install from GitHub using pak     #install.packages("pak")     #pak::pak("USAID-OHA-SI/tameDP")        #load the package     library(tameDP)  ## List the functions available tameDP   ls("package:tameDP")

title:
Import targets and PLHIV data from COP Target Setting Tool (formerly Data 
   Pack)
text: main function tameDP bring import COP Target Setting Tool R make tidy. function aggregates fiscal year targets mechanism level, imports mechanism information DATIM, breaks data elements make dataset usable. Imports Target Setting Tool tidy data frame Breaks data elements stored indicatorCode column distinct columns Cleans HTS variables, separating modalities indicator name Creates statushiv column Cleans separates PSNU PSNU UID distinct columns Adds mechanism information DATIM, including operatingunit, funding agency, partner mechanism name Removes rows targets Allows aggregate PSNU level can use one map() functions purrr package read multiple Target Setting Tools combine. Disclaimer: findings, interpretation, conclusions expressed herein authors necessarily reflect views United States Agency International Development. errors remain .
code: #load package   library(tameDP)    #Target Setting Tool file path   path <- "../Downloads/TargetSettingTool_Jupiter_20500101.xlsx"    #read in Target Setting Tool & tidy  df_tst <- tame_dp(path)   #read in PLHIV and SUB_NAT data from the Target Setting Tool  df_subnat <- tame_dp(path, type = "SUBNAT") #load package   library(purrr)   library(getPass)  #identify all the Target Setting Tool files   files <- list.files("../Downloads/DataPacks", full.names = TRUE)  #read in all Target Setting Tools and combine into one data frame   df_all <- map_dfr(.x = files,                     .f = ~ tame_dp(.x, map_names = FALSE))                      #apply mech_name and primepartner names from DATIM #you will need to provide your DATIM credentials    datim_user_nm <- "spower" #replace with your username   datim_pwd <- getPass() #pop up prompting for your password   df_all <- get_names(df_all, datim_user = datim_user_nm, datim_password = datim_pwd)

text: Target Setting Tool contain information mechanism (names partners). running function, connecting DATIM's SQLView file contains list current mechanisms. requires providing DATIM credentials. left blank function, two dialogue boxes popping asking DATIM username password. running `tame_dp()` across multiple Target Setting Tools, advisable run `get_names()` file dataset produced `tame_dp`.

title: Import mechanism specific info from DATIM — get_names
text: df data frame add mechanism info map_names import names DATIM (OU, mechanism, partner) associated mech_code psnu_lvl aggregate PSNU level instead IM cntry country, grab_info() connecting DATIM datim_user DATIM user name (provided, prompted pop ) datim_password DATIM password (provided, prompted pop )

title: Import mechanism specific info from DATIM — get_names
code: if (FALSE) { #load package   library(purrr) #identify all the Target Setting Tool files   files <- list.files("../Downloads/DataPacks", full.names = TRUE) #read in all DPs and combine into one data frame   df_all <- map_dfr(.x = files,                     .f = ~ tame_dp(.x, map_names = FALSE)) #apply mech_name and primepartner names from DATIM #you will need to provide your DATIM credentials   datim_user_nm <- "spower" #replace with your username   datim_pwd <- getPass::getPass() #pop up prompting for your password   df_all <- get_names(df_all, datim_user = datim_user_nm, datim_password = datim_pwd) }

what: Export Tidy data from Target Setting Tool — tame_dp
title: Export Tidy data from Target Setting Tool — tame_dp
text: tame_dp primary function tameDP package, reading Data Pack munging tidy data frame make usable interact data way stored Target Setting Tool. **Given changes Target Setting Tool year, function works current COP year: COP24.**

title: Export Tidy data from Target Setting Tool — tame_dp
code: tame_dp(filepath, type = "ALL", map_names = FALSE, psnu_lvl = FALSE)

title: Export Tidy data from Target Setting Tool — tame_dp
text: filepath file path Target Setting Tool importing, must .xlsx type dataset extract "PSNUxIM", "SUBNAT", "" [default] specific tab map_names import names DATIM (OU, mechanism, partner) associated mech_code psnu_lvl aggregate PSNU level instead IM

title: Export Tidy data from Target Setting Tool — tame_dp
text: main function `tameDP` bring import COP Target Setting Tool R make tidy. function aggregates COP targets mechanism level, imports mechanism information DATIM, breaks data elements make dataset usable. - Imports Target Setting Tool tidy data frame   - Breaks data elements stored indicatorCode column distinct columns   - Cleans HTS variables, separating modalities indicator name   - Creates statushiv column   - Cleans separates PSNU PSNU UID distinct columns   - Adds mechanism information DATIM, including operatingunit, funding agency, partner mechanism name   - Removes rows targets   - Allows aggregate PSNU level

title: Export Tidy data from Target Setting Tool — tame_dp
code: if (FALSE) { #DP file path   path <- "../Downloads/DataPack_Jupiter_20500101.xlsx" #read in Target Setting Tool (straight from sheets, not PSNUxIM tab)   df_tst <- tame_dp(path) #read in PLHIV/SUBNAT data   df_tst <- tame_dp(path, type = "SUBNAT") #read in PSNUxIM data   df_tst <- tame_dp(path, type = "PSNUxIM") #apply mechanism names   df_tst_named <- tame_dp(path, type = "PSNUxIM", map_names = TRUE) #aggregate to the PSNU level   df_tst_psnu <- tame_dp(path, type = "PSNUxIM", psnu_lvl = TRUE) #reading in multiple files and then applying mechanism names (for PSNUxIM)   df_all <- map_dfr(.x = list.files("../Downloads/DataPacks", full.names = TRUE),                     .f = ~ tame_dp(.x, map_names = FALSE))   df_all <- get_names(df_all) }

title: tameDP 6.1
text: Improve code ordering variables [2024-02-15] Include “<02 Months” “02 - 12 Months” PMTCT_EID trendscoarse [2024-02-15] Add target_age_2024 target_modality_2024 alignment MSD [2024-02-15] Clean README Vignettes [2024-02-14]

title: tameDP 6.0
text: Add trendscoarse exported dataset [2024-01-19] Calculated OVC_HIVSTAT_D, PMTCT_STAT_POS, PMTCT_ART_D targets [2024-01-19] Adjust standardizeddisaggregate mapping (mer_disagg_mapping) HTS_INDEX, OVC_HIVSTAT, PrEP_NEW (KP), TB_STAT [2024-01-19] Cover page now uses FY instead COP, updated grab_info handle either [2024-01-16] Update documentation reflect COP24 [2024-01-16] Archive COP23 version branch archive_cop23 [2024-01-05]

title: tameDP 5.1
text: Change instructions install rOpenSci [2024-01-04] Remove prior year’s HTS targets, coming TB modality [2023-03-29] Break OVC Program Status Care Giver (18+) [2023-03-17] Add additional disagg PrEP_CT’s Test Results [2023-03-17] Update mapping tab, mer_disagg_mapping adopt new disagg naming conventions changing FY24 based pepfar-datim/datapackr output [2023-03-17] Create tame_subnat replace tame_plhiv (soft deprecated) [2023-03-17]

title: tameDP 5.0.0
text: Include file name (source_name) process date/time (source_processed) dataset output [2023-03-02] Transform PrEP_CT.TestResult HTS testing modality convert_mods [2023-03-02] Limit modalities match new targeted modalities [2023-03-02] Update stored country list [ou_ctry_mapping] FY23 countries [2023-03-02] Updated standardizeddisaggregate mapping table (mer_disagg_mapping) match FY23 targets [2023-03-02] Make otherdisaggregate parsing dynamic, rather explicit [2023-03-02] Adjust HTS.Index HTS_Index match indicators [2023-03-02] Correctly adjust year Year 2 targets [2023-03-01] Remove references SNU1, longer included column Prioritization tab Target Setting Tool [2023-03-01] Align tameDP work new, COP23 Target Setting Tools [2023-03-01]

title: tameDP 4.0.4
text: Add package check gagglr [2022-08-15] Align column names new names MSD FY22Q2 [2022-05-16]

title: tameDP 4.0.3
text: Addressed bug OVC duplicated rows due m:m join mer_disagg_mapping [2022-04-20] Add handling prioritization tab missing tame_dp work OPU Data Packs include tab [2022-04-20] Resolves bug reference mech_code get_names mech_code may exist [2022-04-12] Calculate deduplication (00000) mechanism rather importing values PSNUxIM tab [2022-03-23] Add regional operatingunit country names, ou_ctry_mapping, resolve issue Jamaica [2022-03-21; 2022-03-30] Replaces old code get_names utilize gophr::rename_official given size complexities introduced past quarters. [2022-03-15] Adds [gophr][https://usaid-oha-si.github.io/gophr/] [glamr][https://usaid-oha-si.github.io/glamr/] package dependencies [2022-03-15] use gophr::rename_official. [2022-03-15] Pulls SNU1 column Prioritization tab apply data frame using PSNUxIM, SNU1 column included tab. [2022-03-15]

title: tameDP 4.0.2
text: Resolve incorrect disaggregation TX_PREV, HTS_TST, HTS_TST_POS [2022-03-10] Include historic MER results targets output dataset [2022-02-23] Merge prioritizations onto target dataframe [2022-02-23]

title: tameDP 4.0.1
text: Ensure data types correct prior disaggregate binding map_disaggs. Add vignette combining MSD Allow tame_dp read specific tabs instead preset “types”.

title: tameDP 4.0.0
text: Add vignettes package. Add ou_ctry_mapping align countries Operating Units. Update tame_dp work COP22 Data Packs. Allow tame_dp read targets sheets PSNUxIM tab. Consolidate SUBNAT/PLHIV extract tame_dp instead separate function. Applied new logic split_psnu introduced errors OPU generation Aligned exact DATIM target disaggregation Data Pack data map_disaggs. Build site improve documentation.
